names.latin: Radix Potentillae Chinensis, Radix Potentillae Discoloris
names.pharmaceuticalLatin: Radix Potentillae Chinensis, Radix Potentillae Discoloris

category: Herbs that Clear Heat and Purge Fire

action.primary: Clears Heat, detoxifies, clears Wind-Dampness and resolve swelling

indications: Chronic red dysentery, jaundice, swollen, toxic sores and abscesses
Pain in the bones and sinews, seizures and paralysis due to Wind-Dampness

action.primary: Cools the Blood and stops bleeding

indications: Topically as a powder or macerated fresh herb

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yang Deficiency with Cold or Deficiency Cold of Spleen and Stomach.

notes: This herb is said to Cool the Blood to stop bleeding. The source says it astringes to stop bleeding.
To treat uterine bleeding, use large doses (up to 30g).
This herb can be used by itself.
